item.title: How to get more people in your shop with Foursquare a Case Study
item.description: Have you been looking to use social media for marketing? Trying to think of creative ideas to get more people to visit your shops? Foursquare has a number of options for retailers to come up with engaging experiences to get more people in your shops. Foursquare Swarm Badge Party This social media case study for Bite Latvija, a mobile operator shows how Foursquare was used to launch their new technology support centre – this led to increase customer awareness and customer engagement.

item.title: Map My Foursquare unique way to visualise your checkins
item.description:
Not sure where you were yesterday or last week? Map My Foursquare will show you.Map My Foursquare http://mapmyfoursquare.comis unique as it shows you all your recent check-ins – something no other Foursquare app does today.
When you create your map you can share this with your friends on Facebook and Twitter so they can be find out where you were. Don’t worry, Map My Foursquare is concerned for your safety, so you have to login to your Foursquare before creating your map.

item.title: 9 Step Guide to Foursquare for Business
item.description: Fresh off the press and updated for everyone that loves Foursquare – 9 step guide to Foursquare for businesses will get you started today. This guide covers the 9 key points for any retailer – including Why Foursquare! What’s covered in the guide you ask? — then just have a look

item.title: Social Media & Internet Usage Policies for staff and contractors
item.description: I recently answered a question on LinkedIn Answers about workplace policies for staff and contractors. Policies should cover acceptable internet & email usage, social media and also mobiles or other tools of trade.3 Policies every workplace should have for staff and new starters You should have policies for- social media policy to explain what people can do at work internet and email usage policy so staff know its ok to use email or internet Cellphone or mobile policy be clear about who pays for what I think in a positive world, such policies should talk about trust and transparency – so the tone should be positive for example:

item.title: iWork – Pages I don't like
item.description: I started the week with the ambition to just use iWork for a week. Today’s Tuesday and now I see the #failure of such a challenge.iWork Pages can’t convert Word documents so easily I’ve been sent a word document to review for a friend – that should be easy as iWork opens Microsoft Office Word .docx formats. The document opens ok … but the content has been placed into separate textblocks on the page just like any traditional desktop publishing app would do – but of course this was supposed to be a document that needed to be cleaned up.

item.title: Challenge of the week – Can I get by with iWork alone
item.description: Having cleaned up my Macbook Pro and reformatted the hard drive … I’m going to spend the week using iWorkfor all my document needs. I’m a smart guy … I know I love Office for Mac(powerpoint makes any presentation look hot) – but maybe I can be doing sexy presentations in Keynote instead.So I’ve not got Office on my Mac and will let you know – I anticipate that I’ll be frustrated by Pages and its desktop publishing layouts but I should get used to that quickly.

item.title: September Most Popular Posts
item.description: So September has been and gone and now we are into October … The annoying thing about October is that half the world is celebrating spring and half the world is thinking about the last few weeks of summer time 🙁and in other news – I’m back in the UK after spending summer working in Lithuania. Which means it must be time to start organising drinks and networking stuff around Startup Weekend again.

item.title: Insert Disc & Press Enter to Format
item.description: Some old habits die hardand so last night I reformatted my 18 month old macbook pro. I had felt that it was starting to run a bit slow than ‘normal’ and I recently had a problem with a kernel panic (caused when testing a up to 21mb USB modem). So I have a ‘clean’ new computer and that has also given me a chance to think about what to reinstall.

item.title: What is a Social Media Policy
item.description: Are you a fan of social media marketingand driving it for your business? When did you last stop to check that you were protected by your company social media policyor your employee policy allows you to access Facebook, YouTube or Twitter. In many cases, companies do not have a clear policy so the sharing of company information on social networks without the express permission of Marketing or PR could leave you in an iffy situation.

item.title: Damien Saunders has some spare time
item.description: Just keeping you up dated on work and availability – I’ll be back in London from 1 October and am available to come consult on your marketing strategy or work on those end of year projects that are kicking off now.So if you have a project coming up or maybe you are looking for some review or marketing strategy advice please get in contact. Take a look at my profile on LinkedIn if you want to get an idea about my skills and competencies.

item.title: Why you need a social media policy
item.description: Are you responsible for using Twitter at your office? Or maybe you started answering questions from customers on Facebook … if so you should check what your company policy on social media says.Why You Need a Social Media Policy & What should it cover You need a policy to protect yourself and your company – that policy needs to recognise that we all use social media & social networks every day.

item.title: 1st Foursquare Swarm Badge party in Latvia
item.description: Eastern Europe might not be where you would expect to find social media marketing being trialled ‘so soon’. In Latvia, this week a Foursquare Swarm Badgeparty is being organised by a local mobile operator Bite Latvija.Latvia is fairly new to smart phones – but Twitter has been embraced by internet users – first for finding and following news stories and now Twitter is more popular than Facebook. So it must be possible to get 50 people in a room with a joint interest in new technology and mobile phones.

item.title: UPDATED: Twitter Tools – CoTweet best for your business
item.description: CoTweet provides the easiest way for your business to start managing your company or brand on Twitter. If you already are using HootSuite or Tweetdeck you should stop for a minute and check you are doing the right thing for your business. CoTweetis designed for the multi-user / multi-site (!!) environment with assignment, archiving and other management tools – this means you’ll never lose a tweet again (or have to share the computer with your boss).

item.title: Are Twitter Followers better than Fans?
item.description: Are Twitter Followers better than Facebook Fanswas a topic discussed on emarketer recently. It’s a question I get asked all the time – relatively speaking – Which is the best social network to start social media marketing? The thing is you need to try them both at the same time.And here is the problem every social network has its pro’s and cons – and here is the answer. If you were a criminal, on trial in the Old Bailey, the prosecution’s job is to prove you had the intention of committing a crime, so it was just an accident.

item.title: Get your message right – Effective Marketing Strategy
item.description: Creating an effective marketing strategyduring a recession is tough. When you’re faced with budget cuts to your marketing spend or trying to figure out what you can do with no budget then you need a plan. The third step to this plan is to get your message rightWhat is your customer telling you? Customers are always looking for 2 things – The right priceor a better offer. Westerners may not be as good at bargaining as some cultures are, but we all want to know we got a good deal.

item.title: WP Supercache – were you seeing Garbage
item.description: Sorry … I didn’t realise … my site has been having problems for a couple of weeks now. It turns out the WP Supercache a [ id=”693″ type=”post”]favourite WordPress[/] plugin was corrupting my site due to a conflict with my server compression.My Google Analytics bounce rate reports were quite high for the past couple of weeks and I didnt see anything was wrong until someone told me they were seeing garbadge on my website.

item.title: Know your target – Effective Marketing Strategy
item.description: Creating an effective marketing strategyduring a recession is tough. when you’re faced with budget cuts to your marketing spend or trying to figure out what you can do with no budget then you need a plan. The second step to this plan is to know your target.Picture your ideal potential customer In any business you need to market to three types of customers. The potentials who don’t know about you, your existing customers and your lapsed customers.

item.title: 5 Steps to Effective Marketing Strategy – Know your market
item.description: Creating an effective marketing strategyduring a recession is tough. When you’re faced with budget cuts to your marketing spend or trying to figure out what you can do with no budget. You need an effective marketing strategy. The first step to this plan is to know your market. It’s a sad fact that if you don’t market your product, service or even yourself … Then any potential customers will not find you.

item.title: 5 steps to create an effective marketing strategy in a downturn
item.description: Creating an effective marketing strategyduring a recession is tough. When you’re faced with budget cuts to your marketing spend or trying to figure out what you can do with no budget then you need something better than a good plan, you’re needing a marketing strategy that leads to success. This week, Ill be writing about 5 steps to create an effective marketing plan. All too often we run out of time and take a JFDI attitude towards to planning and strategy.

item.title: Social Tools for Customer Service – Get Satisfaction
item.description: Get Satisfaction– its what you want when you ring a call centre – like your bank, your tax office or some other service provider. Get Satisfaction, if you don’t know it is the name of a powerful web based customer service tool which helps customers to connect and help themselves. I’ve just launched a Get Satisfaction forum to demonstrate the features of their free service – and it works well.

item.title: Bit.ly Making offline marketing work for social media with URL shortener
item.description: Engagement metrics and CPE are going to become more popular this year and next year, and so how do you take the offline world online? Or how can you start track the value of that billboard you just spent 10,000,000 dollars on? Well that looks obvious! So how are you tracking offline to online engagement? At the moment Bit.ly Pro offers free service – you provide a customer domain or sub domain and it does the rest.

item.title: August 2010 – Most Popular Posts
item.description: So AUGUST has been and gone and now we are into September … already September has started out cold n wet for many people. item.title: How do you measure ROI in social media?
item.description: All to often people or companies start using social media but don’t know how to measure the return on investment or calculate a payoff from using social media. Here’s a few easy ideas to start calculating ROIs for you to consider.Calculating ROI for your CFO Typically a ROI calculation is your total revenue or benefit divided by the costs. But if it cost you zilch to setup the twitter account .

item.title: Foursquare Rules of Play Change – only 1 checkin a day allowed
item.description: Foursquare, one of my favourite location based mobile social networks has changed its rules for the game of ‘who wants to be a Mayor’. Foursquare is growing in popularity in a number of cities and rules for game play have been tightened. Recently it changed the rules to the most checkins in the past 60 days .. and now it has changed to only 1 checkin is valid each day.

item.title: Lithuania Youth love Basketball
item.description: Lithuania is a basketball crazy nation – which may seem odd if you know little about this newer European Union state. Lithuania has had a long history with basketball even in the days of the Soviet Union (USSR). Lithuania will also be hosting the Mens European Championships in summer 2011. Something to look forward too. I guess as the days grow darker and colder, indoor team sports like Basketball are good for the fans and the players.

item.title: Which Social Media experience is right for you?
item.description: How to tell what is right in social media? Myth: Build it & they will come Love great content … Love Google Just listen to social media is not a good position

item.title: Vilnius Lithuania loves Foursquare
item.description: Foursquaretoday is the most popular mobile checkin app in Vilnius, Lithuania. While not everyone here can afford the iPhone – many people are using Foursquare on their Blackberry. Point of note – Blackberry App World is not available in Lithuania and so people are using hacks to install this. Here’s a couple of screenshots from Checkin Mania confirming the number of venues is great in Foursquare vs Gowalla in the central old town area.

item.title: Vilnius Youth in Lithuania get up to no good
item.description:
In Vilnius, the capital city of Lithuania its youth get up to no good. Just like all young people do! Here’s a few photos from the last week to prove how bad these youngsters can be. Vilnius main drag @4pm on the HOTTEST day (ever) is deserted cause word had got around that 2 skate boarding youth were taking over the town.
Vilnius main tourist attraction is its iconic cathedral and separate bell tower, in this shot the youth of today are street dancing!

item.title: Lithuanian Youth love their mobiles
item.description:
In Lithuania mobile penetration is almost at 150% – so is this all from younger people sim swapping?
Mobile Youth in Lithuania (16-24 yo) are all using multi-sims for the best deals and free calls. The 3 main operators are Omnitel, Bite and Tele2. Freedom of choice means that handsets are not subsidised very much and customers have to pay full price for a phone. Even the the ‘popular’ iPhone is over priced and still exclusive with one operator and on a 24 month contract.

item.title: Lithuanian Youth love to use the Internet
item.description: In Lithuania the usage of the internet is reaching saturation point. A 2009 official report shows 95% of young people aged 16-24 with internet access**.** Lithuania has one of the highest per capita access to broadband ratios due to small land mass and population of just under 4 million. It’s also atypical of ‘westernised’ European markets and the Lithuanian youth are no different – wanting mobile phones, good clothes, good education and a future with a good job (most likely in London).

item.title: Damien Saunders examines Social Media in Vilnius Lithuania for a few months
item.description: From: Our intrepid report Location: Vilnius, Lithuania Date: 8 August 2010 This could sound like the start of yet another long worded PR update with little to say and lots of flowery prose. Who I am to say if I write long winded rambling sentences with little or no meaning? But anyway – I digress, Ill be working for a couple of months in Lithuania (yes in the East of Eastern Europe near the Baltic Sea).

item.title: July 2010 Most Popular Posts
item.description: So July has been and gone and now we are into August … if you missed some of the news and opinions from the past month, then here’s a reminder of what you enjoyed most: HOW TO Claim your business listing in Foursquare – If you’re just getting started with Foursquare or not sure how to manage your listing, then read on Essential Location Based Apps for Android Mobiles – update on the mobile apps available in the Android Market Foursquare most popular location checkin game in London – You guessed it.

item.title: Social Media Reputation Management using LinkedIn
item.description: Managing your online reputation will be more important over time for everyone – as we grow up the content and material that search engines will collect about us is phenomenal. For many, the CV will cease to exist and be replaced by online reputation, search engine results and specialist business networks like LinkedIn.LinkedIn has managed to hold on to the title of business social network over increasing competition from Facebook and other professional networks like Xing or even Plaxo.

item.title: Social Media Reputation Management – Google Profile
item.description: Did you know that Google has a profile page and that it’s similar to a profile page on LinkedIn. Managing your reputation and curating your personal SEO plan is something you should do at least once a year. About Google Profile Google Profilecan be associated with a normal Gmail e-mail address along with Google Apps domains and other addresses. In fact, you’ll find that if you use Google your profile comes ‘pre-filled’ with info on what Google might know about you.

item.title: NEWS: Price Grabber research says we spend more on the mobile
item.description: Finally some proof that Mobile Internet usage is profoundlyshaking up the way consumers shop, according to new research from PriceGrabber.co.uk. Of the 908 online shoppers that were asked about their mobile shopping habits, 66 percent owned a Smartphone or another Web-enabled phone. Of the consumers who shop from their mobile, nearly half (48 percent) claim that the convenience of having the Internet with them wherever they go is their number one reason for smart shopping.

item.title: HOW TO: View your WordPress Website on iPhone or Android
item.description: WordPressis a very comprehensive all-round tool for websites – and its not just for blogs. If you’re starting out with WordPress and need your site to look smooth on a mobile phone like the iPhone or any big screen Androidmobile then you’ll need a plugin for this.The best plugin for WordPress that handles any mobile device is easily WPtouch iPhone Theme. Once the plugin is installed and activated its working for you straight away.

item.title: HOW TO export posts from WordPress to Word Doc via PDF in Mac OSx
item.description: WordPress is one of the best end to end solutions for building a website and it has a large selection of themes, plugins and tools to make it more than just another blog. I recommend WordPress at the start of any project – just because it typically requires less management involvement or decisions from the IT or Tech teams to get started with.Having spent a lot more time writing about Social Media lately, I wanted to collect these posts into an editable collection (maybe I should have started by writing all my posts in word you might say).

item.title: Essential Collection to Get Started with Foursquare
item.description: If you’re new to _Foursquare_ or your business is wondering how to leverage geolocation social networks in areas like sales and marketing, customer service or retention then this _essential collection_ will help you to get started.Of course, when you first started using Facebook, Foursquare, Gowalla, MySpace, etc, etc your initial experience is about ‘what does this do for me’, not ‘what can my business do with this’. If your business is new to this then take a look at my social media marketing kit.

item.title: Gowalla needs business tools for super users
item.description: Gowalla may just be a buzzword for the latest social media marketing trend – but with more people getting smart or superphones that ‘can’ multi-task location based _mobile social networks_ are set to be the in thing. Gowalla just needs some tools for business owners or super users to curate or manage business and locations listing (or to give me access to these).Without some of these basic tools for store owners or community managers the opportunitiy to market using Gowalla are very limited.

item.title: Social Media Marketing – Integrate with traditional marketing activities
item.description: Today’s marketing activities are changing – you can say old skool marketing is being overtaken by new skool ideas and techniques. _Social Media Marketing_ techniques mean you can integrate activities across the marketing mix and do it for ‘free’. Before you cut your budget for traditional marketing like PR, Direct Mail, Radio, Press, TV or Outdoor – STOP – Think about it and find out how to integrate your social media marketing into your traditional marketing channels and _take the conversation online_.

item.title: Easy Guide to Social Media Marketing & Location
item.description: This easy guide to social media & location marketingwas something I published only to SlideShare – a new channel which has great potential for B2B digital marketing. This guide sums up key activities to get you started and is a bit of motivation that you can share with office colleagues. Key points include: Claim your Business on Foursquare Claim your Entry on Google Maps Create an Email Newsletter Create a Facebook Website Cross Promote using Twitter, Facebook and your website

item.title: Social Media Marketing – Integrate across the marketing mix
item.description: Social Media Marketing presents the opportunity to try a number of different social networks and promote or market in these as appropriate.Each social network has its own pro’s and con’s such as Twitter is more like a broadcast, one way radioand a Facebook fan page can create conversations that people can easily follow and read. When you start out with social media marketing, the best sites to start with are:

item.title: Gowalla New Users heading toward 350000
item.description: Gowallaand Foursquareare getting more and more attention and a few companies are starting to monitor and track these services. RJ Metrics monitors both services and predicts Gowalla’s user base will shortly make it to 350,000.Somewhere amongst the stats, you’ll see new users for Gowalla are growing around 2,000 per week but Foursquare recently peaked at 20,000 new users. Summer is usually quieter months for data revenue and usage (same for Jan & Feb Downunder), it will be interesting to track the user take up and usage to see if this is different.

item.title: Social Media Marketing Essential Collection to get started
item.description: Optimising for Social Media Marketingwill start to develop as a set of tools or addons to be used as part of a marketing promotion or campaign. If you’re just getting started with social media then you don’t need to optimise, you just need to start out with the right attitude and a good plan.Getting Started with Social Media Marketing In this first collection of articles, I’ve discussed 4 critical areas or rules:

item.title: Get started with Foursquare for Social Media & Mobile Marketing
item.description: Foursquareis a location based service(LBS) for your mobile and at the same time its a social network. In the past 12 months Foursquare has grown in popularity to possibly be the biggest Geo Location Based Social Networkin the UK – well at least in London. Foursquare (the name is from a school yard game played in the USA) started about 2 years back and has apps for iPhone, Android & BlackBerry … this is a free business directory where every listing was added by a customer or a visitor to that shop.

item.title: 8 Step Guide to Foursquare
item.description: With all the excitement of _Foursquare_ heading to 2,000,000 users this week it was time to post this 8 step guide to Foursquare to help you get started using this geo-location social network.8 Step Guide is a easy to follow and includes tips like: Claim your business Run Competitions for Customers Reward the Mayor Track your Checkins Cross promote Foursquare on Twitter, Facebook & your website

item.title: HOW TO Claim your business listing in Foursquare
item.description: Foursquareis a popular geo location based social network and available on mobile for iPhone, Androd & Blackberry phones. The business directory listings are free to add and initially added by customers or visitors to stores or shops who check-in.You need to claim your business entry so you can update the details and add special offers for Mayors, visitors etc. Your business or store is probably already in the directory if you are in London or a major city.

item.title: Foursquare usage peaks on the weekend
item.description: Foursquareusage peaks on the Saturday night reports BitsyBot Labswho studied a weeks worth of checkin data from the geo location based mobile social network. Well that’s nothing new – anyone working in mobile and content or value added services will be able to match that insight with data usage and revenue trends. Saturday Nights all-right for Checkin Mania I love that BitsyBot completed this research and it will help lots of poor social media marketing people looking to calculate an ROI.

item.title: Essential Location Based Apps for Android Mobiles
item.description: Everyone is used to taking their mobile with them, so that means location basedapps for mobiles will start to become more popular. A recent issue of Wired noted that it was thanks to Foursquare& Gowalla, that people are now getting more used to sharing their location. On a fun side, many of the new location based mobile apps have games or allow you to collect rewards for visiting new places. Here’s an essential list of location based apps for Androidmobile.

item.title: Foursquare user base to hit 2 million this week
item.description: Foursquareand Gowallahave been grabbing the headlines and few companies are starting to monitor and track these services. RJ Metrics claims Foursquare will hit 2 million usersthis week.Somewhere amongst the stats, you’ll see new users for Foursquare are growing around 14,000 per week but recently peaked at 20,000 new users. This is probably due to active promotions such as being featured in Apple or Android TV adverts. August & September are usually quieter months for data revenue and usage thanks to Summer (same for Jan & Feb Downunder), it will be interesting to track the user take up and usage to see if this is different.

item.title: What will be your next Foursquare Badge – new Hubspot Grader tool
item.description: If you’re using Foursquare for social media and personal fun, you’ll be interested to know about the new-ish tool from Hubspot. Square Graderis their new tool which rates your Foursquare profile and what’s interesting is it predicts your next Foursquare Badge. Square Grader may not be their finest tool – unlike their other tools which grade your websiteor blog, Square Grader doesn’t offer much in the way of suggestions to improve your rating.

item.title: Start a Social Media Marketing Plan – what do you want to achieve?
item.description: The start of any social media plan should actually be the end … by that I mean decide on the goals or what you want to achieve. Any good marcomm person or project planner will thank you for this. So what are good outcomes? what do you want to achieve? If you’re starting out in Social Media Marketing you’ll be wanting to get your ‘profile page’ or fan pages just right, get some friends and get some traction.

item.title: Foursquare most popular location checkin game in London
item.description: Foursquare is still the UK’s most popular location based check-in game to play on your mobile. I’ve said it before that Foursquare would come out on tops over Gowalla and Brightkite. These maps (thanks to Checkin Mania) indicate the difference in the number of locations that users have submitted to each service. The growth from crowd sourced locations and points of interest reflects in the growth of that services usage (ie the most popular service gets the most contributions from users) The point of reference is London Borough Market – one of the more famous places in London to visit.

item.title: Most popular posts for June
item.description: Summer is a peak time for social media marketing activity and there has been a lot going on. What have you noticed in the way of marketing around town? Each month I try to look back and reflect a little on what was written and posted here. Here are the Top 3 posts by popularity from June. How to Use Twitter for your startup Essential Collection of ZOHO CRM resources Best Collection of tools for Twitter

item.title: Damien Saunders Foursquare Super Mayor
item.description: Looking for some help with your Foursquare and Social Media Marketing? Then look no further than the badges of the people who you work with. Damien Saunders has been working hard to collect badges, pins, mayorships to be able to provide the best insights and metrics for the location based checkin mobile games. The game inside Foursquare has two parts: Any user can become a Mayor when they check-in the most to a particular venue, Users get badges for activities like going to a 5 different coffee shops.

item.title: Start a Social Media Marketing Plan – write your plan
item.description: Start a Social Media Marketing Plan in writing … as we have all probably heard or read, putting even the vaguest plan down on paper will help to make your ideas concrete! The benefit of having a plan on paper means you can consider if your plan and goals are realistic and you can decide as well how involved you want to be in social media marketing.How to Write a Social Media Marketing Plan Your first social media marketing plan need only cover 4 areas:

item.title: Foursquare Swarm – find 50 of your best friends in the one place
item.description: Foursquare can be loads of fun for the casual user and collecting badges can be just as fun as trying to be the local town mayor. Foursquare has still to come up with a good tool for events, but it does have the Swarm badge. Get 50 of your best friends to checkin at the same location at the same time … and you’ll get the Swarm badge too. Are you using Foursquare or Gowalla?

item.title: Start a Social Media Marketing Plan – why you need to use social media?
item.description: Starting your plan for social media marketing in a small or big business should be driven by a need or a reason. Why use Social Media – because your customers are using it! First step in your social media marketing plan is to open powerpoint or write on a flipchart the reason why you need to use social media, some good reasons include: most of our target audience use social media (no brainer), or because visits to your brand or company website are down as our customers spend more time on social media sites (better) to deliver a sales & marketing programme using online & social media There are probably plenty of other good reasons you can think of.

item.title: Start a Social Media Marketing Plan – why social media?
item.description: Do you really need a Social Media Marketing Plan? And if your business needs a plan … why does it have to be social media? Why Social Media Every business – big, small, startup or established brand needs to be using social media – yesterday. I was reading a flyer today which said ‘its critical for every website to include social media’ — its not the website that needs it … its your marketing and sales plan!

item.title: Start a Social Media Marketing Plan – don’t leave it to the PR person
item.description: Social Media marketing – using Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Foursquare, Google+ … needs to form part of any marketing plan across the marketing mix. Treating Social Media as a separate activity from the rest of your marketing is a No-No … In fact social media should be integrated into every campaign or promotion. Social Media marketing fits into new customer acquisition, customer retention, CRM, customer loyalty and anything else that customers do and thats true for D2C brands as well as B2B marketers.

item.title: FREE Download Guide to installing Virtualbox and TinyXP on a Mac
item.description: If you’ve read any of my popular post on Virtualbox for a Mac you’ll know that they are short, easy to follow and up to date. Now I’ve updated it and created it as a PDF for your to download and have your own copy of my guide

item.title: Essential Collection of ZOHO CRM Guides
item.description: Here is a summer essential collection for ZOHO CRM a customer relationship management or CRM solution. When you get started in business your sales and marketing activities will need to be split 3 ways – Customers who are buying from you Nurturing Customers who will buy from you Generating new leads or potential customers This may seem daunting – so from the day you open your doors or your new web business you’ll want a tool to track all your customers and maybe your suppliers too.

item.title: HOW TO Can’t Install Windows 7 upgrade with Virtualbox
item.description: This is an extremely short guide to a major problem with Windows 7 using Virtualbox. Many users come to this site looking to find the answer – which is – Windows 7 Home Upgrade is sold in Europe and elsewhere as a full install version. The problem is that installation via Virtualbox will complete but the user will not be able to ‘register’ their copy Windows 7. The only way to install Windows 7 Upgrade using Virtualbox is to first install Windows XP and then run the Windows 7 Upgrade disc.

item.title: London Startup Weekend June 2010 Teams
item.description: Here is the full list of the teams from London Startup Weekend June 2010. I’ve now added this as a page on the London site. The next weekend for London will be announced soon.. item.title: London Startup Weekend Day 2 Summary
item.description: Day 2: London Startup Weekend … Friday night’s ideas and pitch session, finished with 12 formative teams. When they arrived on Saturday this had started to change and a couple of teams merged. Saturday morning we go down to work quickly with our mentor Raam CEO from Touchnote spending team with every team. In the afternoon Andrew Lockley came around to mentor and we were joined by Alex vanSomeren from the Cambridge entrepreneur scene.

item.title: I'm looking for a new project or work
item.description: So after things quiet down this weekend, I mean after London Startup Weekend has finished and the dust has settled … as of Monday, I’m a free agent looking for new work and a new project to get stuck into. Given my all rounder background in social media and digital marketing … if you’re in need of someone who can move between planner, strategist, manager or something else then get in touch.

item.title: London Startup Weekend starts in 2 days (insert panic now)
item.description: London Startup Weekend, the 54 weekend event for anyone into startups or running their own business starts this Friday. Yes I’m going mental and about to have a breakdown. The weekend is going to awesome. I’m running around organising food for everyone, organising drinks for everyone and every 2 mins it seems someone wants a new press release or post on the website london.startupweekend.org My hats off to anyone who steps forward and says ‘Ill organise a 2.

item.title: 50 Completely Useful stats for social media & mobile marketing
item.description: To understand more about Social Media and Mobile Marketing its important to get a few facts together on current trends and insights. 50 completely useful stats for social media does just that. Why do this? well it helps to create some drive … and helps to understand why anyone or any business needs to do more in social media and mobile marketing. ** **

item.title: London Startup Weekend
ZOHO CRM – What do you think?
item.description: Zoho CRM is a great platform and tool for customer relationship management. It’s suitable for the self employed, SOHO, SME or just about anyone wanting to track leads and contacts . I’ve written a few posts now on my experiences using ZOHO CRM to help others. If you’re reading this … what do you think of ZOHO CRM?

item.title: Book Review: Virtualbox 3.1 Beginners Guide
item.description: As far as book reviews go, from personal experience they are much harder to write then a review of a music album or live gig. So when reading VirtualBox 3.1 Beginners Guideby Alfonso V. Romero (Packt Publishing) I was surprised at how easy the book was to read and how an experienced VirtualBox user can dip in and find something new. VirtualBox is one of my favourite system virtualisation apps that I use on my Mac and my Windows machines.

item.title: HOW TO: Google Maps Local claim your business
item.description: Google Maps is the first site that any business should visit before starting mobile or geospecific marketing. Google Maps Local provides a range of tools to make it easy for anyone to check their details and claim your business. Why do you need to claim your business on Google Maps? We all know the phenomenon that is searching for something on Google from a Mobile – so as more people have Androidphones or iPhones or other smartphones, more people will use Mobile Internet for Search.

item.title: 3 must try Android Apps to manage wifi
item.description: Managing wifi on your Android mobile phonecan be a hassle, so at least there are now 3 good apps for you to use to make your wifi experience better. ##Wifinder Is the most technical looking of the 3 apps – turning it on was a bit of shock when compared to the user experience of the other 2 apps. WiFinder only has 1 button aptly labelled New Scan. You then press and hold on the WiFi SSID to see the more familar Android Wifi Connect.

item.title: Gowalla? Foursquare open for Business? Who will setup a business team in Europe First
item.description: Foursquare is now open to business and is moving beyond geo-tagging and location based social networking. But is Foursquare really open to business? After trying to claim my business location and setup an offer for visitors its now been 3 weeks without a reply. In the UK right now, I believe there is an opportunity for Gowalla, Foursquare, etc to setup a small but viable business team to work with digital agencies or mobile marketing specialists here.

item.title: Virtualbox has a new how to book
item.description: Virtualbox – is my favourite tool for creating and running all things windows or linux on my mac. Installing Virtualbox on a mac with windowsis a breeze and its easy to run then having to reboot into bootcamp. Now Packt Publishing have released VirtualBox 3.1: Beginner’s Guide this sample chapter is for Linux host machines. The book’s ambition is to ‘give you a thorough introduction to this award-winning virtualization product’. It will help you implement the right virtual environment for you.

item.title: HOW TO: Keep your Wifi connection awake on Android
item.description: Most people read this post because to find out how to change the Wifi settings on their Android phone. You might be wanting to save battery or figure out how to keep wifi on when your phone screen is off / idle. It’s very easy to change this setting and I prefer to keep wifi on when the phone is plugged into the mains power, this means your news and rss clients will synced overnight when you’re sleeping.

item.title: Skimlinks is working – is it afiliate marketing or what?
item.description: I just added the Skimlinkswordpress plugin to my site. Skimlinks is my first step into affiliate marketing (is that what it is?). The wordpress plugin was very easy to install – but I think I should have read up more on affiliate marketing so it was over to the NMA magazine who recently ran an special on affiliate marketing to help me out. In essence, affiliate marketing involves any 3rd party creating content that is linked to a product page and the affiliate gets a commission for the sale.

item.title: HOW TO: ZOHO CRM empty your Recycle bin to delete accounts & contacts
item.description: ZOHO CRM is one of the best web based (SaaS) customer relationship management solutions around today and it’s got great features even in its free version. How to delete your contacts, leads, accounts and is pretty easy thing to manage in ZOHO, but until you empty your Recycle Bin, they are still there (and this can affect some reports and views). The Empty Recycle Bin icon is at the top of the screen on the right hand side … clicking it will show you whats in your recycle bin and you can then choose to empty it or recover records.

item.title: London Startup Weekend June 4 – 6 tickets on sale
item.description: **Damien Saunders is organising the next London Startup Weekend (http://london.startupweekend.org) @startuplondon which will take place June 4 – 5 – 6 2010 in just under a month at the IBM offices on London’s Southbank. Getting around to organising a weekend like this is taking up a little bit of my time .. but I believe in the concept and the cause – and its going to be a great weekend!

item.title: ZOHO CRM do you use your own custom web form? Then change to https
item.description: ZOHO CRM has some great features including web to lead forms – but they don’t really look too stylish. Especially if you use 3rd party tools for your web forms. If you use custom web to lead forms you may have to make the change to using the more secure HTTPS connection. After I noticed the web to lead form was not working I checked the standard code from ZOHO.

item.title: Android Markets – Going International – advice for developers, VCs & startups
item.description: Developing for Android? You need to look to the bigger picture … actually this applies to anyone developing apps for mobile phones. If you want your app to be used by people that don’t speak English you need to translate it and provide some support. There are going to be many opportunities for startups and anyone with a business model to go ‘international’ or expand abroad should check these points are covered in the marketing and product development plans.

item.title: Android Phones – product life cycle & how to choose
item.description: What with all the new Android phones, its time to look at the phones to not buy, unless you’re stuck for cash or just want your first touch phone. There are many terminal vendors and operators with Android phones to choose from HTC, Sony Ericsson, Motorolla, T-mobile, Vodafone and Google (HTC). General Points on Buying a Phone Why buy a phone on a contract the total cost of ownership over a 18 month or 2 year contract will be expensive.

item.title: Why Mobile? Why Now? – short guide to mobile marketing
item.description: A short guide to mobile marketing is as short as it can get – and provides just enough insights, trends and key facts to help make the most of mobile marketing. What’s included in this is 8 quick suggestions how to include mobile marketing in your marketing strategy.

item.title: ZOHO CRM adds call logging for leads & contacts
item.description: ZOHO CRM a web based (SaaS) customer relationship management solution (CRM) recently added a bunch of new features. item.title: South Africa … 5 million online and growing
item.description: South Africa is one of the fastest growing markets for mobile and internet usage is also growing rapidly. A history of poor international bandwidth / connectivity has meant speeds have remained slow. South Africa’s internet users grew from 4.6 million to 5.3 million last year, a rise of 15%, according to research by World Wide Worx, a technology and research and strategy organisation, sponsored by Cisco. The climb follows years of stagnation between 2002 to 2007, when internet penetration in South Africa never rose above 7%.

item.title: Sony Ericsson's first Android phone
item.description: Sony Ericsson delivered a blow to Microsoft on Tuesday when it unveiled its latest Xperia handset, which unlike its Windows-powered predecessors is based on Google’s Android operating system. Called X10, the flagship smartphone comes with a new Sony Ericsson-designed user interface that aggregates the user’s contacts and communications from the likes of Facebook and Twitter into a single address book. The system is akin to HTC’s Sense interface, and Motorola’s Motoblur interface, both of which feature on the respective companies’ new Android phones.

item.title: Does building an iPhone App make cents? sense?
item.description: With the boom in the number of apps in the App Store (over 100,000) and total downloads in excess of 2bn … someone has got to be making money … right?In part, the iPhone does offer a better platform for apps – it’s about to overtake RIM as the leading consumer smartphone, sold more than 34 million units and got some of the highest mobile internet usage rates we’ve seen so far.

item.title: Giving Great Service – learning from Turkey's positive over employment
item.description: Excellence in customer service is one thing that Turkey can be proud of. There are many positiv arguments for employing people in ‘low paid’ jobs that improve everyones living. It’s been 2 years since I was living in Istanbul. I’ve returned for a week and was looking out for signs of the impact of the ‘credit crunch’.

item.title: Tip of the Day: Windows Vista SP2 won't install on a partitioned drive
item.description: Tip of the day: Windows Vista clean install doesn’t work on a partitioned drive AND if you then partition the drive after installing Vista, the SP2 will not install as well. Effectively this means you should keep your primary drive as 1 partition … or wait til after you’ve installed Vista and all the service packs. There is a short microsoft kb on this …. Will this affect installing Windows 7 for the same reason … I think so.

item.title: Orange UK to get Apple
item.description: Apple’s iPhone will be available to Orange customers in the UK later this year, ending rival O2’s exclusive deal over the must-have handset, the mobile operator said. The announcement by Orange ends months of speculation that it was trying to muscle in on O2’s deal with Apple, which gave it exclusive UK rights to the iPhone in 2007. The 3G and 3GS versions will be available to Orange UK customers “later this year”, but no further details of dates, handset costs or tariffs are available yet, the firm said.
